years.label: Year 7
years.overview: We kick off KS3 by learning how to create crisp, scalable graphics. Think “logo designer” energy.

topics.title: Developing vector graphics
topics.summary: Create digital artwork using shapes, paths and layers — with a focus on precision and design choices.
topics.intro: Vector graphics are made from shapes and paths, so they stay sharp at any size. Perfect for logos, icons, and anything that shouldn’t turn into pixel soup.
learningGoals: Use shapes and lines to build images
Edit paths and nodes to refine designs
Organise work using layers and grouping
Choose colours, fonts and alignment with purpose
Export graphics for different uses such as web and print
mastery: Create a logo or icon that meets a design brief
Apply consistent colour and typography choices
Export files correctly with the right size and format

lessons.title: Using vector tools to draw and modify shapes
lessons.outcome: I can use software to draw and modify vector shapes.

lessons.title: Working with multiple objects
lessons.outcome: I can work with multiple objects to create a vector drawing.

lessons.title: Vector paths
lessons.outcome: I can edit the paths of vector shapes to create unique shapes.

lessons.title: Developing a vector product
lessons.outcome: I can plan and design a vector product for a given project.

lessons.title: Vector markup
lessons.outcome: I can investigate the markup of a vector graphic and change an object by modifying its markup.

lessons.title: Comparing bitmap and vector graphics
lessons.outcome: I can compare vector and bitmap images and decide which is most suitable for different purposes.

years.label: Year 8
years.overview: This is where we start programming properly: writing Python that takes input, makes decisions, repeats actions, and produces outputs you can actually use.

topics.title: Introduction to Python Programming
topics.summary: Learn the core building blocks of programming using Python.
topics.intro: Python is a general-purpose programming language. We use it to learn how programs store data, make decisions and repeat actions.
learningGoals: Use variables to store and update values
Take input and produce clear output
Debug common syntax and logic errors
mastery: Build small Python programs such as quizzes or calculators
Fix errors using evidence rather than guesswork

years.label: Year 9
years.overview: We focus on working with collections of data in Python — the real world is rarely one value at a time.

topics.title: Python programming with sequences of data
topics.summary: Use strings and lists, loop through data, and build programs that manage collections reliably.
topics.intro: Sequences allow programs to store and process multiple values. This unit develops techniques for working with lists and strings.
learningGoals: Create and use lists and strings
Access items in a sequence using an index
Use loops to process sequences of data
Design simple algorithms that work with collections of data
mastery: Write programs that store multiple values
Use loops to calculate totals, counts or averages
Test programs using different data sets
